results.title: One fine day (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Michael Hoffman, Lynda Obst and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: An unlikely romance develops when two single parents share babysitting for a day. Melanie (Michelle Pfeiffer), is a single mother with a busy career as an architect. Jack (George Clooney), is a commitment-shy newspaper columnist who has access to his daughter on the weekends, although his ex-wife’s sudden elopement has Jack looking after his daughter during the week. When their children miss the boat for a class field trip, Jack and Melanie agree to share babysitting shifts, leading to a day of interesting and romantic developments as they struggle with their day to day work, the children, and the feelings that are developing between them. Cast includes Michelle Pfeiffer, George Clooney, Mae Whitman and Charles Durning.

results.title: Hustler white (E)
results.creator_credit: Bruce LaBruce, Rick Castro, Jurgen Bruning and Hustler White productions
results.brief_description: Co-director and star Bruce LaBruce’s sleazy and explicit tour of the LA hustler and porn scene is a humorous and twisted take on Billy Wilder’s “Sunset Boulevard and” the more unsavory moments of “Whatever happened to Baby Jane”. Model Tony Ward stars as Monti- a hustler who becomes the lust object and obsession for Bruce Labruce’s melodramatic journalist, Jurgen Anger. “Hustler White“‘s use of real life hustlers and gay porn actors, along with Labruce’s own gay porn background (he has directed and stared in the underground and very pornographic, Super 8 1/2 and No Skin off my Arse) gives the film a candid documentary feel. Hustler White was co-directed by gay photographer Rick Castro.

results.title: Magical mystery tour
results.creator_credit: Bernard Knowles, George Harrison, John Lennon, Paul McCartney, Ringo Starr and Beatles
results.brief_description: Join The Beatles on an hallucinatory mystery tour to the tunes of “Baby your a rich man”, “Penny lane”, “Flying”, “The Fool on the hill”, “All you need is love”, “Strawberry fields forever”, “Blue jay way”, “Hello goodbye”, “I am the walrus”, “Your mother should know”, and “All my loving”.

results.title: The Old man and the sea
results.creator_credit: Judd Taylor, Robert E. Fuisz, William F Storke and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description: A stunning dramatisation of Hemingway’s epic tale of struggle between man and nature. Anthony Quinn stars as Santiago, whose encounter with a giant Marlin becomes a fight for survival as a band of sharks move in for the kill. Filmed on location on the British Virgin Islands, this film combines action-packed excitement with outstanding human drama.

results.title: Greyfriars Bobby: the true story of a dog
results.creator_credit: Don Chaffey and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the children’s book by Eleanor Atkinson, this delightful movie tells the story of a lovable and faithful terrier named Bobby. Bobby is owned by the family at Cauldbrae Farm, but he chooses his own master in “Old Jock”(Alex Mackenzie), caretaker at the farm. When Jock dies, Bobby remains steadfast in his refusal to leave his master’s gravesite at the estate where he worked. The new caretaker of the farm, James Brown (Donald Crisp), is not keen about having Bobby forced on him but the dog manages to work his way into his heart. Set against the picturesque Scottish countryside this film also stars Laurence Naismith and Kay Walsh and is a remake of “A Challenge to Lassie”.

results.title: Immortal beloved [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Bernard Rose, Bruce Davey and ICON
results.brief_description: When a cryptic letter from musical genius, Beethoven, turned up shortly after his death, it started one of history’s most compelling romantic mysteries. An enduring riddle that remains unsolved to this day. Who, among the scores of women that Beethoven seduced, was his “Immortal Beloved”? Gary Oldman and Isabella Rossellini share a love as hypnotic as the music Beethoven created, in this enthralling film based on the celebrated life of one of the greatest composers that ever lived.

results.title: Brimstone & treacle
results.creator_credit: Richard Loncraine, Kenith Trodd and Namara
results.brief_description: A strange young man, Martin Taylor (Sting), infiltrates his way into the family of a vulnerable middle aged couple Tom and Nora Bates (Joan Plowright and Denholm Elliot). Martin becomes infatuated with their daughter Patricia (Suzanne Hamilton), who has been comatose for 4 years. The part angel, part devil Martin, mysteriously rouses sleeping beauty from her slumber. Adapted from the play by Dennis Potter, this film is bizarre to say the least and was banned by the BBC shortly after being taped.

results.title: Wild target
results.creator_credit: Pierre Salvadori, Philippe Martin and Sharmill Films
results.brief_description: This is a winning black farce and a wistful romantic comedy. Starring seasoned veteran Jean Rochefort as a grave-faced professional hitman who guided by his mother in the family business has reached the pinnacle of his career. He is a control freak and self-improver, meticulous at work and at home and a confirmed bachelor and erstwhile linguist. Hard at work one day he runs into a young man (played by Guillaume Diepardieu) who becomes his reluctant apprentice with hilarious results. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Who framed Roger Rabbit?
results.creator_credit: Robert Zemeckis, Frank Marshall, Robert Watts, Amblin Entertainment and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: A magical blend of live-acting and animation that comes off brilliantly due to the super effort by Bob Hoskins in playing to imaginary “co-stars” who were drawn in later. Hoskins plays Eddie Valiant, a has-been gumshoe in the ‘40s film noir mould who comes out of a self enforced retirement. Someone is out to steal Toon Town from the cartoon characters who inhabit the magical land. To get their hands on the valuable property they frame its biggest star, Roger Rabbit for murder. Detective Valiant must solve the case and save the toons. Cast also includes Christopher Lloyd, Joanna Cassidy, Stubby Kaye and Charles Fleisher. Based on the story “Who censored Roger Rabbit?” by Gary K. Wolf and winner of four Academy Awards.

constellations_other.name: Animal hijinks
constellations_other.description: As long as stories have been told on screen, audiences have loved films, TV shows, memes and videogames about animals being naughty. This constellation shares some key examples of animal comedy throughout the ages.

results.title: This sporting life
results.creator_credit: Lindsay Anderson, Karel Reisz and Independent Artists (GB)
results.brief_description: Richard Harris gives a superb performance as Yorkshire coal miner Frank Machin, who dreams of achieving public acclaim by making a name for himself on the City Rugby team. He performs with tenacity and aggressiveness and earns a place on the team as well as 1000 pounds. His desire of being well liked extends to his personal life as he seeks the approval and affections of his widowed landlady Mrs Hammond (Rachel Roberts). After initial resistance the two become lovers and it is at this physical level that their relationship remains. When Frank’s friend marries, Mrs Hammond is racked with bitterness about her relationship and Frank responds in the only way he knows how, with violence. As tragedy strikes, Frank is left only with his sporting life. Also starring Colin Blakely, Alan Badel and William Hartnell and adapted by David Storey from his own novel.
